text: Marcus Lorenzo Storey (born November 9, 1982 in Chicago, Illinois) is an American soccer forward, who last played for the German club BSV Schwarz-Weiß Rehden. ==Career== Storey played college soccer at the University of North Carolina, where he played forward. Following being named the ACC Rookie of the Year in 2001, Storey was named to the All-ACC first team as a junior and a senior. He finished his career with the Tar Heels with 39 goals and 19 assists in 106 games.Marcus Storey - NORTH CAROLINA OFFICIAL ATHLETIC SITE - Men's Soccer Upon his graduation, Storey was drafted 20th overall in the 2005 MLS SuperDraft by the Columbus Crew.Houston Dynamo: Roster - Player Bio = Marcus Storey He was traded to Houston prior to the 2006 season.Spielerinformationen - Marcus Storey: C - Sportsmanagment However, after spending the season with the Dynamo, he was cut during the 2007 pre-season, a move to make the team roster-compliant.Soccer Source: Marcus Storey Finally Set To Join German Team In January 2008 he joined TuS Heeslingen in Germany, in the Oberliga (Fourth division),Marcus Storey - SV Drochtersen/Assel - Kicker.de he left the club in June 2008 and he joined SV Wilhelmshaven in the new (Third division) and on June 30, 2009 left Wilhelmshaven to sign for SV Drochtersen/Assel. ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:American expatriate soccer players Category:American expatriate soccer players in Germany Category:American soccer players Category:Association football forwards Category:Carolina Dynamo players Category:Columbus Crew SC draft picks Category:Columbus Crew SC players Category:Expatriate footballers in Germany Category:Houston Dynamo players Category:Major League Soccer players Category:North Carolina Tar Heels men's soccer players Category:People from Missouri City, Texas Category:Soccer players from Texas Category:USL League Two players Category:SV Drochtersen/Assel players Category:Sportspeople from Houston
